frontmatter.abstract: When evaluating Shiny applications in terms of web accessibility, assessment tools will always throw an error: 'Document language missing'. Shiny does not set this attribute and others like it by default. In this tutorial, we will learn how to fix this.
frontmatter.title: Setting Document Attributes

frontmatter.abstract: Learn how to retrieve window dimensions and use them in the Shiny server. You probably will never need to use window dimensions in R, but this tutorial demonstrates how to send data from JavaScript to R.
frontmatter.title: Get Window Dimensions

frontmatter.abstract: Drag and drop elements may be useful for advanced user interactivity. You can use draggable elements in many situations, such as allowing users to personalize the UI. In this tutorial, learn how to create a draggable element and the required javscript events.
frontmatter.title: Drag and Drop Example

frontmatter.abstract: The leaflet package in R is great package for creating interactive maps in shiny. However, if you are using larger datasets or running a lot of server-side jobs, it may take some time for the leaflet map to render and update. Displaying progress indicators can improve the user experience by reassuring the user when something is happening and how long it might last.
frontmatter.title: Leaflet Busy Element

frontmatter.abstract: For the 2020 shiny apps contest, I developed an app that provides travel recommendations based on your preferences for coffee, breweries, and museums. This app demonstrates how to create a custom shiny framework and integrate non-R/non-shiny tools into the development process.
frontmatter.title: shinyTravel

frontmatter.abstract: Managing css can become difficult as projects grow and new features are added. Using a css preprocessor brings many helpful features for writing and managing css. In this tutorial, learn how to use SASS in your shiny applications.
frontmatter.title: Shiny and CSS Preprocessors

frontmatter.abstract: Data tables are a good method for displaying data on the web. However, this can lead to issues of content overflows on mobile devices or if the browser is resized. In this tutorial, we will learn how to create a responsive table for use in shiny.
frontmatter.title: Responsive Datatables

frontmatter.abstract: There isn't a time input in the shiny framework. A time input element is useful for data entry shiny apps or if you need to filter data by hour or minute. In this example, learn how to create a custom time input component using Shiny input bindings.
frontmatter.title: Creating Custom Inputs

frontmatter.abstract: For some apps, you may need to style the selectInput widget. Styling the element can be tricky. Learn how to use standard html elements and css to create your own input.
frontmatter.title: Custom Select Inputs

frontmatter.abstract: Rmarkdown is perfect for shiny applications. If you have set content that needs to update when a new selection is made, you can pass parameters from your ui and server into a Rmd template.
frontmatter.title: Using Rmarkdown files in Shiny

frontmatter.abstract: Learn how to add custom js functions for more interactivity in shiny apps. In this example, we will create a dark and light theme toggle and learn how to save the user preferences for later use.
frontmatter.title: Getting started with JavaScript handlers

frontmatter.abstract: Over the years, I developed a standard project structure that works well with developing shiny applications. See how I structure projects and view my shortcuts for getting projects up and running.
frontmatter.title: How I structure my shiny projects

frontmatter.abstract: Okay. I have created custom navigation. What if my app has multiple pages with tabs. How do I go to a specific tab on another page?
frontmatter.title: Linking Tabs - Part 3

frontmatter.abstract: Now that I created custom links, what can I do with them? How about adding them in a leaflet popup?
frontmatter.title: Linking Tabs - Part 2

frontmatter.abstract: Creating links to other pages in your shiny app can be challenging as ids are overwritten each time a shiny app launches. Instead, we will learn how to create new links using javascript.
frontmatter.title: Linking Tabs - Part 1

frontmatter.abstract: Are you tired of the same start up pages? Learn how to create a cool landing page. This demo was inspired by a post on community.rstudio.com.
frontmatter.title: Landing Page

frontmatter.abstract: In my app, I want to set up some sort of user authentication where certain groups can see some pages and some groups can see all pages. Can I do this in shiny? Yes! Here's how to do it.
frontmatter.title: Login Screen

frontmatter.abstract: Have you ever wanted to edit data in a shiny app? Learn how to build a shiny app for editing data and saving changes to file, and then reloading the changes into your app.
frontmatter.title: Data Editor
